meanings.definition: To make conservative or more conservative in character or principles.
meanings.sent1: The old library was conservatized by adding more classic books to its collection.
meanings.sent2: The company's policies were conservatized to align with traditional values.
meanings.sent3: The party was conservatized so much that they only played music from the 1950s.
meanings.sent4: Her wardrobe was conservatized to resemble that of a 1950s housewife.
meanings.sent5: The garden was conservatized with only native plants to maintain its natural beauty.

meanings.definition: To adapt or conform to conservative beliefs or practices.
meanings.sent1: She conservatized her speech to appeal to the conservative audience.
meanings.sent2: The school curriculum was conservatized to include more traditional values.
meanings.sent3: He conservatized his wardrobe by wearing more neutral colors.
meanings.sent4: The town conservatized its policies to reflect the values of its residents.
meanings.sent5: The restaurant conservatized its menu by adding more classic dishes.
